tool.name: netboxr
tool.description: netboxr enables automated discovery of biological process modules by network analysis.

param.name: gene_list
param.label: Gene list
param.help: A newline-delimited text file that contains a list of genes of interest

param.name: cutoff
param.label: P-Value Cut-Off
param.help: The corrected p-value (or q-value) cut-off to apply for the graph output. Default: 0.05

param.name: community
param.label: Community detection method
param.help: Community detection methods include edge betweenness score (EBC), leading eigenvector method (LEC), Louvain method (LOUV), or Leiden method (LEID). Default: EBC

param.name: globalModel
param.label: Global network null model
param.help: Perform global network null model analysis. The global network null model calculates the empirical p-value as the number of times (over a set of iterations) the size of the largest connected component (the giant component) in the network coming from the same number of randomly selected genes equals or exceeds the size of the largest connected component in the observed network. Default: Yes

param.name: globalIterations
param.label: Global network null model iterations
param.help: Global network null model iterations. Recommended: 1000

param.name: globalNumber
param.label: Global network model number of genes
param.help: Global network null model number of genes.

param.name: localModel
param.label: Local network null model
param.help: Perform local network null model analysis. The local network null model evaluates the deviation of modularity in the observed network from modularity distribution in the random network. Default: Yes

param.name: localIterations
param.label: Local network null model iterations
param.help: Local network null model iterations. Recommended: 1000

param.name: networkPlot
param.label: Network plot
param.help: Output the annotated graph of netboxr output. Default: Yes

param.name: outputSIF
param.label: Network in SIF format
param.help: Output the network in SIF format. Default: Yes

param.name: neighborList
param.label: Neighbor list
param.help: Output a table containing the information of all neighbor nodes. Default: Yes

param.name: modmem
param.label: Module membership
param.help: Output a table containing the identified pathway module numbers. Default: Yes

param.name: nt
param.label: Node type
param.help: Output a table containing the information of node types. Default: Yes

tool.help:
NetBox is a network-based approach that combines prior knowledge with a network clustering algorithm. The algorithm allows for the identification of functional modules and allows for combining multiple data types, such as mutations and copy number alterations. NetBox performs network analysis on human interaction networks, and comes pre-loaded with a Human Interaction Network (HIN) derived from four literature curated data sources, including the Human Protein Reference Database (HPRD), Reactome, NCI-Nature Pathway Interaction (PID) Database, and the MSKCC Cancer Cell Map.
-----
**INPUTS**
**Gene list** A newline-delimited text file that contains a list of genes of interest is required.
Example of text file contents:
EGFR TP53 ACTB GAPDH
**Cutoff value** The corrected p-value (or q-value) cut-off to apply for the graph output. The default p-value is 0.05.
**OUTPUTS**
* A PDF with a plot of the edge annotated graph (optional)
* A text file with tabular data containing information of all neighbor nodes (optional)
